intro: Scleranthus setifer, commonly known as the bristly sickleweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its erect, slender stems covered in stiff, bristly hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, typically from July to September. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slightly hairy surface. Scleranthus setifer is adapted to dry, rocky habitats and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides.
